page.title: 03Barnston, Lt Dunmow, Felsted
page.content:
The houses in this area are mainly old, dating back as far as the thirteenth century. There are many examples of Essex thatch and pargetting which attracts tourists to the largely unspoilt picturesque villages of Little Dunmow and Felsted.
There are many large country houses (some with stables) spread throughout the area. There is also a moated farm house.
A few Victorian buildings were erected, such as the old schools at Little Dunmow and Barnston which are now converted to houses.
Continued on next page.
